div.p: Ecoregional differences in arrival trend vs. green-up trend relationship and in explaining trend in phenological interval. ( A) Relationship between trend in bird species arrival and trend in green-up. Each symbol represents a species, and symbol colour and shape indicate the primary ecoregion of the species’ breeding range, as defined in Fig. 1 (only the most occupied region shown). Black line indicates linear regression for all species ( p < 0.001), blue line indicates where trend in arrival equals trend in green-up. The trend for all species was statistically significantly ( p = 0.004) different from slope = 1 (blue line), indicating trend in arrival changed less than trend in green-up. ( B) Ecoregions as linear regression coefficients predicting trend in phenological interval across species. Bars indicate 95% confidence intervals.
